66b48bee-eb65-4681-a4ba-bc63972fa29b.description: The course introduces basic concepts in predictive analytics, the most prevalent form of data mining, and covers the two core paradigms for business applications of predictive modeling: classification and prediction. This course is useful for professionals who want to understand what predictive modeling might do for their organization, undertake pilots with minimum setup costs, or manage predictive modeling projects or ongoing predictive modeling deployments.
66b48bee-eb65-4681-a4ba-bc63972fa29b.name: Predictive Analytics 1 - Machine Learning Tools (#601)

endorsements.description: This credential has been successfully evaluated by the American Council on Education for college credit. d6942d63-ca39-4f7f-92b2-da619b10000d.description: The course continues work from Predictive Analytics 1 and introduces additional techniques in predictive analytics, the most prevalent form of data mining. The course includes hands-on work with R, Python or Excel Solver software. This course is especially useful for analysts and managers who want to undertake pilots with minimum setup costs, manage predictive modeling projects, or work with consultants or technical experts involved with ongoing predictive modeling deployments.
d6942d63-ca39-4f7f-92b2-da619b10000d.name: Predictive Analytics 2 - Neural Nets and Regression (#602)

dc9b1914-b246-44a4-ab61-4e54bcac3cbd.description: The course objective is to teach a mix of quantitative and qualitative methods for describing, measuring and analyzing social networks. Students will learn how to identify influential individuals, track the spread of information through networks, and see how to use these techniques on real problems.
dc9b1914-b246-44a4-ab61-4e54bcac3cbd.name: Introduction to Network Analysis (#511)

badge_template_activities.title: The methods of assessment include written papers, quizzes, and more with a minimum passing score of 80%.

endorsements.description: This credential has been successfully evaluated by the American Council on Education for college credit. Is is recommended for 3 Upper-Division Baccalaureate college credits in Network Analysis. For more information about ACE Learning Evaluations, visit www.acenet.edu.

3402033a-102d-4558-8c1d-a8766d3c7689.description: The course objective is to cover key unsupervised learning techniques including association rules, principal components analysis, and clustering. Students also review integration of supervised and unsupervised learning techniques. Participants apply data mining algorithms to real data, and interpret the results. A final project integrates an unsupervised task with supervised methods covered in predictive Analytics 1 and 2. Students use either R, Excel Solver or Python software.
3402033a-102d-4558-8c1d-a8766d3c7689.name: Predictive Analytics 3 - Dimension Reduction, Clustering, and Association Rules (#603)

badge_template_activities.title: The methods of assessment include quizzes, and more with a minimum passing score of 80%.

Is is recommended for 3 Upper-Division Baccalaureate college credits in Predictive Analytics. For more information about ACE Learning Evaluations, visit www.acenet.edu.

9d7dc1ed-faa7-4108-b4fe-faf806cde641.description: The course objective is to cover how to apply linear programming to complex systems to make better decisions - decisions that increase revenue, decrease costs, or improve efficiency of operations. Students will explore the role of mathematical models in decision-making and how to formulate basic linear programming models where multiple decisions need to be made while simultaneously satisfying multiple conditions or constraints.
9d7dc1ed-faa7-4108-b4fe-faf806cde641.name: Optimization - Linear Programming (#610)

badge_template_activities.title: The methods of assessment include quizzes, and more with a minimum passing score of 80%.

endorsements.description: This credential has been successfully evaluated by the American Council on Education for college credit. Is is recommended for 3 Upper-Division Baccalaureate college credits in Linear Programming. For more information about ACE Learning Evaluations, visit www.acenet.edu.

79411ef2-e085-4bc9-920b-332d571e1413.description: The course objective is introduce on the most popular business forecasting methods: regression models, smoothing methods including Moving Average (MA) and Exponential Smoothing, and Autoregressive (AR) models. It also discusses enhancements such as second-layer models and ensembles, and various issues encountered in practice.
79411ef2-e085-4bc9-920b-332d571e1413.name: Forecasting Analytics (#510)

badge_template_activities.title: The methods of assessment include written papers, quizzes, and more with a minimum passing score of 80%.

4bbfadb3-8a19-482b-ab4b-642984a8ef1b.description: The course objective is to teach students how to manipulate a dataset in order to perform a desired calculation or answer a particular question, as well as to understand relational database files, load MySQL and read in .csv data. Students will also learn how to write and filter queries, incorporate functions, perform subqueries and how to join tables.
4bbfadb3-8a19-482b-ab4b-642984a8ef1b.name: SQL - Introduction to Database Queries (360)(v.3)

badge_template_activities.title: The methods of assessment include quizzes, with a minimum passing score of 70%.

endorsements.description: This credential has been successfully evaluated by the American Council on Education for college credit. It is recommended for a total of 3 Lower-Division Baccalaureate college credits. For more information about ACE Learning Evaluations, visit www.acenet.edu.

a4dead2b-72c4-4b18-872e-02cb1c1d8f50.description: The course teaches interactive exploration of data and how it is achieved using state-of-the-art data visualization software. Students explore different data types and structures and interactive techniques for manipulating and examining data to produce effective visualizations. Students are guided through an analysis of quantitative business data to discern meaningful patterns, trends, relationships, and exceptions that reveal business performance, potential problems and opportunities.
a4dead2b-72c4-4b18-872e-02cb1c1d8f50.name: Interactive Data Visualization (#622)

badge_template_activities.title: The methods of assessment include written papers, quizzes, and more with a minimum passing score of 80%.

d21e392f-1edf-4184-9f28-b6569db9ad7c.description: The course explains how to (1) construct and implement simulations to model the uncertainty in decision input variables and supplement the overall estimate of interest by a risk interval of possible other outcomes using risk simulation; (2) model the variability in arrivals over time and ensuing queues, using queuing theory; (3) how to employ decision trees to incorporate information derived from models to actually make optimal decisions.
d21e392f-1edf-4184-9f28-b6569db9ad7c.name: Risk, Simulation and Queuing (#621)

badge_template_activities.title: The methods of assessment include quizzes, and more with a minimum passing score of 80%.

endorsements.description: This credential has been successfully evaluated by the American Council on Education for college credit. It is recommended for a total of 3 Graduate college credits in Decision Science. For more information about ACE Learning Evaluations, visit www.acenet.edu.

30887ef2-c8f1-4ff3-9cb5-bb358fa23b42.description: The course focuses on a logistic regression approach for analyzing contingency table data, where the cell entries represent counts that are cross-tabulated using categorical variables. It lays the groundwork for logistic regression models for binomial responses and goes on to introduce more complex data structures. Students get a broad view of the generalized linear model framework and are also exposed to several model variations.
30887ef2-c8f1-4ff3-9cb5-bb358fa23b42.name: Categorical Data Analysis (#641)

badge_template_activities.title: The methods of assessment include case studies, examinations, quizzes, with a minimum passing score of 80%.
Instructional strategies include: audio visual materials, case studies, discussion, computer-based training, project-based instruction, coaching/mentoring, practical exercises, lectures.

endorsements.description: This credential has been successfully evaluated by the American Council on Education for college credit. It is recommended for a total of 3 Graduate college credits in Statistics. For more information about ACE Learning Evaluations, visit www.acenet.edu.

085d0ddd-4d83-429b-8f3e-9ddde475d442.description: The course objective is to introduce the student to the fundamentals of probability and study design including statistical significance, categorical data and contingency tables, random sampling, the Bootstrap, confidence intervals and more. You will also learn basics of inference and association including confidence intervals for proportions, correlation and simple regression, multiple regression, and using regression models to make predictions.
085d0ddd-4d83-429b-8f3e-9ddde475d442.name: Introductory Statistics for College Credit (#201)

badge_template_activities.title: The methods of assessment include quizzes, and more with a minimum passing score of 70%.

1a1d73ca-b74a-4d2e-a397-35616e06cf0f.description: The course objective is to introduce basic Python skills and data structures, how to load data from different sources, rearrange and aggregate it, and finally how to analyze and visualize it to create high-quality products.
1a1d73ca-b74a-4d2e-a397-35616e06cf0f.name: Python for Analytics (#556)

badge_template_activities.title: The methods of assessment include quizzes, and more with a minimum passing score of 80%.

endorsements.description: This credential has been successfully evaluated by the American Council on Education for college credit. Is is recommended for 3 Upper-Division Baccalaureate college credits in Python. For more information about ACE Learning Evaluations, visit www.acenet.edu.

45979688-115a-41b4-a5f7-d647abc5963c.description: The course objective is to explain how to derive multiple linear regression models, how to use software to implement them, and what assumptions underlie the models. You will also learn how to test whether your data meets those assumptions, what can be done when those assumptions are not met, and strategies to build and understand useful models.
45979688-115a-41b4-a5f7-d647abc5963c.name: Regression Analysis (#642)

badge_template_activities.title: The methods of assessment include quizzes, and more with a minimum passing score of 80%.

endorsements.description: This credential has been successfully evaluated by the American Council on Education for college credit. It is recommended for a total of 3 Graduate college credits in Regression Analysis. For more information about ACE Learning Evaluations, visit www.acenet.edu.

13d5eb1d-70a6-4b89-91c1-a6443c8016cc.description: The course covers principles, techniques and tools in financial quantitative risk analysis. It combines theoretical sessions and real-world applications with classroom exercises to provide a comprehensive overview of Monte Carlo techniques. Students discuss recent innovations in Monte Carlo methods using practical examples, case studies and interactive sessions. Theyuse the @RISK software package and Excel to learn risk analysis modeling environments, common mistakes, and how to avoid them.
13d5eb1d-70a6-4b89-91c1-a6443c8016cc.name: Financial Risk Modeling (#615)

badge_template_activities.title: The methods of assessment include quizzes, and more with a minimum passing score of 80%.

endorsements.description: This credential has been successfully evaluated by the American Council on Education for college credit. 89d4f453-206b-4a19-8666-f64887967c9d.description: The course objective is to introduce students to the basics of programming in Python, on either Windows or Mac. Students will use both Jupyter notebooks and standard script editors, and work through simple arithmetic operations, statistical operations, variables, keywords, lists, arrays, and dictionaries. Students use Conda to install modules and close with some data visualizations.
89d4f453-206b-4a19-8666-f64887967c9d.name: Introduction to Python Programming (355)(v.1)

badge_template_activities.title: The methods of assessment include quizzes, with a minimum passing score of 70%.

f48f727b-c52c-4a3d-9cbc-93ba168f042b.description: The course provides an introduction to programming in R. Topics include understanding file formats, basic R syntax, and how to use text editors to write code. Students will learn to read in files, use symbols and assignments, and iterate simple loops, and the course closes with a discussion of data structures and subsetting.
f48f727b-c52c-4a3d-9cbc-93ba168f042b.name: Introduction to R Programming (250) (v.4)

badge_template_activities.title: The methods of assessment include quizzes, with a minimum passing score of 70%.

ec51436d-3163-41dc-9657-3224f7f79bbd.description: The course objective is to cover basic statistical concepts of probability, confidence intervals and medical vs. statistical significance. The second half of this course teaches clinical trial designs including randomized controlled trials, ROC curves, CI and tests for relative risk and odds ratio, and an introduction to survival analysis.
ec51436d-3163-41dc-9657-3224f7f79bbd.name: Biostatistics for Medical Science and Public Health 1 & 2 (491)(v.5)

badge_template_activities.title: The methods of assessment include examinations, quizzes, with a minimum passing score of 70%.

endorsements.description: This credential has been successfully evaluated by the American Council on Education for college credit. Is is recommended for 3 Upper-Division Baccalaureate college credits in Biostatistics. For more information about ACE Learning Evaluations, visit www.acenet.edu.

64be904b-56ef-47d8-aa68-85ccd7f08c1b.description: The course objective is to cover issues that need to be addressed in order for a study to produce statistically valid conclusions. The course deals with statistical study designs that are not experiments and are used with observational data. Examples are drawn primarily from the epidemiology literature where the methodology of observational studies has been developed, and clinical trials are reviewed briefly.
64be904b-56ef-47d8-aa68-85ccd7f08c1b.name: Designing Valid Statistical Studies (463)(v.1)

badge_template_activities.title: The methods of assessment include quizzes, with a minimum passing score of 70%.

It is recommended for a total of 1 Lower-Division Baccalaureate college credits in Statistics. For more information about ACE Learning Evaluations, visit www.acenet.edu.

f3ca7422-7935-4102-9992-f84241e5cefa.description: The course describes the various methods used for modeling and evaluating survival data, also called time-to-event data. General statistical concepts and methods discussed in this course include survival and hazard functions, Kaplan-Meier graphs, log-rank and related tests, Cox proportional hazards model, and the extended Cox model for time-varying covariates. The course requires participants to use a convenient statistical package to analyze survival analysis data.
f3ca7422-7935-4102-9992-f84241e5cefa.name: Survival Analysis (#660)

9e898813-5274-41c0-be04-09689ea979ab.description: The course objective is to provide information to specify and implement optimization models that solve network problems (what is the shortest path through a network, what is the least cost way to route material through a network with multiple supply nodes and multiple demand nodes). Students also learn how to solve Integer Programming (IP) problems and Nonlinear Programming (NLP) problems. Spreadsheet-based software is used to specify and implement models.
9e898813-5274-41c0-be04-09689ea979ab.name: Integer & Nonlinear Programming and Network Flow (#625)

89931beb-2068-416b-b59a-73ba8c81e415.description: The course objective is to teach about deep neural networks, and how to use them in processing text with Python (Natural Language Processing or NLP).

39c511b2-6c60-4145-a3e1-27b46f3614be.description: The course objective is to teach how to find appropriate voter targets, design survey instruments, and assess the effectiveness of voter contacts, as well as implement various predictive models and testing methods to choose optimal campaign messages and media.
39c511b2-6c60-4145-a3e1-27b46f3614be.name: Persuasion Analytics and Targeting (700)(v.2)

99158977-1cdf-43de-addd-a8004c2a7ca8.description: The course objective is to provide an understanding of the problem and the context, and continue to clean, prepare and explore the relevant data. You'll work on feature engineering, handling dates, summarization, and how to work with the customer lifecycle concept in data analysis. The course culminates with a report that you will write, and a recommendation that you will prepare for a hypothetical company. Prerequisites: R Programming; Statistics
99158977-1cdf-43de-addd-a8004c2a7ca8.name: Customer Analytics in R (614)

b5160503-42b1-446b-9ebb-ab4d3e6ae83f.description: The course objective is to discuss the logic of meta-analysis and the way that it is being used in many fields, including medicine, education, social science, ecology, business, and others. We will also look at various controversies in meta-analysis (such as questions of mixing apples and oranges and "garbage-in-garbage-out"), and draw on recent headline-making analyses to understand real-world examples.
b5160503-42b1-446b-9ebb-ab4d3e6ae83f.name: Meta Analysis (462)(v.1)

ff4d608c-32ac-43f3-8329-9bfcae7e5ae9.name: Matrix Algebra Review (#306)

The course offers a framework to follow in implementing data science projects, and an audit process to follow in reviewing them. Case studies along with R and Python code are provided.
8f06ae18-a65a-41c6-a5de-943e0286ae2a.name: Responsible Data Science (567)(v.1)

In contrast with the detailed step-by-step approach in an introductory course, this more advanced course will use a more open and independent learning style, and students should expect to occasionally wrestle a bit with the concepts and be comfortable with a trial-and-error approach.
1159ae64-df9f-4848-9ab7-866da70f9d9b.name: R Programming - Intermediate (452)(v.3)

f954c91f-cff9-49ed-a5f6-4e1151cca3aa.description: The course objective is to introduce the relationship between maps and the data they represent and how such data are coded in the R environment. You will explore point pattern analysis, spatial autocorrelation statistics, and geostatistical interpolation to estimate values across a continuous contour type map.
f954c91f-cff9-49ed-a5f6-4e1151cca3aa.name: Spatial Statistics with Geographic Information Systems (#640)

27d44e8b-75d8-46aa-a202-88b314ad6d91.description: The course objective is to cover the application of predictive modeling algorithms to healthcare scenarios and data. You will learn how to formulate predictive modeling problems, train different types of predictive models on data where the target outcome is known, assess the performance of those models using holdout data not used in training, and use the resulting models to predict new data. You will also learn how to audit models for potential bias and unfairness.
27d44e8b-75d8-46aa-a202-88b314ad6d91.name: Predictive Analytics for Healthcare (668)(v.1)

d3066ec3-0d41-44f6-aa68-975c02670f1c.description: The course objective is to emphasize underlying concepts and methods of epidemiology. Topics include: study designs (clinical trials, observational studies, case-control studies, and cross-sectional), measures of disease frequency and treatment effect, and controlling for extraneous factors.

endorsements.description: This credential has been successfully evaluated by the American Council on Education for college credit. It is recommended for a total of 3 Lower-Division Baccalaureate college credits in Epideimological Statistics For more information about ACE Learning Evaluations, visit www.acenet.edu.

d3749caf-371d-4312-bc5c-2e754f5733b6.description: The course objective is to read, understand, manipulate, and use data. There is no prerequisite knowledge for this course, but it does require access to Excel. After taking this course, you will have the ability to make meaningful information from data. From this information, you will also be able to make decisions scientifically.
d3749caf-371d-4312-bc5c-2e754f5733b6.name: Introduction to Data Literacy (103)(v.1)

badge_template_activities.title: The methods of assessment include written papers, performance rubrics/checklists, with a minimum passing score of 70%.
Instructional strategies include: discussion, practical exercises.

endorsements.description: This credential has been successfully evaluated by the American Council on Education for college credit. It is recommended for a total of 1 Lower-Division Baccalaureate college credits in Data Management. For more information about ACE Learning Evaluations, visit www.acenet.edu.

250b77f3-79f6-4e41-b184-f3412245b0ae.description: The course objective is to teach statistical techniques associated with the major end points for clinical trials. You will study the domain (what is a clinical trial?), principles of experiment design, and how to develop a statistical analysis plan including trial objectives, hypotheses, and choice of techniques.
250b77f3-79f6-4e41-b184-f3412245b0ae.name: Introduction to Statistical Issues in Clinical Trials (564)(v.1)

badge_template_activities.title: The methods of assessment include quizzes, with a minimum passing score of 70%.
Instructional strategies include: case studies, discussion, computer-based training, practical exercises.

endorsements.description: This credential has been successfully evaluated by the American Council on Education for college credit. It is recommended for a total of 2 vocational/certificate college credits in Clinical Trials. For more information about ACE Learning Evaluations, visit www.acenet.edu.

27efca47-5937-47c9-b228-93bc615ef524.description: The course objective is to continue the introduction to R programming, and covers how R works with numeric vectors, and how to deal with special values. Students will start working with R to handle text data, and learn about regular expressions, dates, classes, and generic functions, as well as matrices, data frames, and lists. Some prior programming experience and some familiarity with an installed R system is required.
27efca47-5937-47c9-b228-93bc615ef524.name: R Programming - Introduction 2 (351)(v.3)

badge_template_activities.title: The methods of assessment include quizzes, with a minimum passing score of 70%.
Instructional strategies include: discussion, computer-based training, practical exercises.

endorsements.description: This credential has been successfully evaluated by the American Council on Education for college credit. For more information about ACE Learning Evaluations, visit www.acenet.edu.

d193da6f-abc4-41e8-9cd7-dee2a8c188b4.description: The course objective is to teach how to use machine learning and statistical methods to identify clusters in multivariate data, i.e., groups of cases that have relatively high within-group similarity. Using those same methods, and additional ones, students will also learn how to identify cases that are relatively unique - anomalies (also called outliers).
d193da6f-abc4-41e8-9cd7-dee2a8c188b4.name: Statistical and Machine Learning Methods for Analyzing Clusters and Detecting Anomalies (613)(v.1)

badge_template_activities.title: The methods of assessment include quizzes, with a minimum passing score of 80%.
Instructional strategies include: discussion, computer-based training, practical exercises.

endorsements.description: This credential has been successfully evaluated by the American Council on Education for college credit. It is recommended for a total of 3 Graduate college credits in Statistics. For more information about ACE Learning Evaluations, visit www.acenet.edu.
